browser Module¶

Bases: pythonzombie.dom.BaseNode

A Browser object, analogous to zombie.Browser.

An alias for Browser.queryAll.

Parameters:
  • selector – a string CSS selector (http://zombie.labnotes.org/selectors)
  • context – an (optional) instance of DOMNode

html(selector='html', context=None)¶

Returns the HTML content of the current document.

Parameters:
  • selector – an optional string CSS selector (http://zombie.labnotes.org/selectors)
  • context – an (optional) instance of DOMNode
location¶
pressButton(*args, **kwargs)¶
query(selector, context=None)¶

Evaluate a CSS selector against the document (or an optional context DOMNode) and return a single DOMNode object.

Parameters:
  • selector – a string CSS selector (http://zombie.labnotes.org/selectors)
  • context – an (optional) instance of DOMNode
queryAll(selector, context=None)¶

Evaluate a CSS selector against the document (or an optional context DOMNode) and return a list of DOMNode objects.

Parameters:
  • selector – a string CSS selector (http://zombie.labnotes.org/selectors)
  • context – an (optional) instance of DOMNode
text(selector, context=None)¶

Returns the text content of specific elements

Parameters:
  • selector – a string CSS selector (http://zombie.labnotes.org/selectors)
  • context – an (optional) instance of DOMNode

More Browser/DOMNode shared functionality.

class pythonzombie.dom.DOMNode(index, client)¶

Bases: pythonzombie.dom.BaseNode

DOMNode represents a node in the current document’s DOM.

checked¶
click(*args, **kwargs)¶
css(selector)¶

An alias for DOMNode.queryAll.

fill(*args, **kwargs)¶
fire(*args, **kwargs)¶
json¶
query(selector)¶

Evaluate a CSS selector against this node and return a single

(child) DOMNode object.

queryAll(selector)¶

Evaluate a CSS selector against this node and return a list of (child) DOMNode objects.

tagName¶
value¶
class pythonzombie.dom.Queryable¶

Bases: object

An abstract base class which represents a DOM reference point from which a CSS selector can be applied.

decode(value)¶
encode(value)¶
pythonzombie.dom.verb(f)¶

Methods that are decorated as @verb should always return a reference to the original object (e.g., Browser, DOMNode) to allow function chaining.
